item.title: Contacts
item.description:
Contact E-mail

For any questions, please contact us at ecrfb26@gmail.com. One of the organizers will respond to you promptly.

Please do not send abstracts to this email address. Abstracts must be submitted exclusively through the official registration form.

item.title: Program
item.description: The conference program features 26 talks (6 invited and 20 contributed) organized into four thematic blocks, highlighting both theoretical and experimental advances in Flat Band Physics. Invited talks are 50 minutes long, starting with a 20-minute pedagogical introduction, followed by a 20-minute presentation of the speaker’s own work, and 10 minutes for questions. Contributed talks are 20 minutes long, with 15 minutes for presentation and 5 minutes for discussion. All participants will have the opportunity to present their research during a poster session at the end of the first day.

item.title: Useful Information
item.description:
How to get to Würzburg

By train: Arrive at Würzburg Hauptbahnhof (main station).

By plane:

  • Frankfurt International Airport: Take a direct ICE train from the airport to Würzburg Hauptbahnhof.

  • Nuremberg Airport: Take the U2 to Nuremberg Hauptbahnhof, then a train to Würzburg Hauptbahnhof.

From the Station to the University (Building Z6):

  • Bus 14, direction Gerbrunn: Get off at Campusbrücke and cross the bridge.

  • Bus 114 (direction Universität Sportzentrum) or 214 (direction THWS): Get off at Philosophische Fakultät and walk about 350 meters.

item.title: Venue
item.description:
The conference will take place at the Building Z6, Hubland Süd, 97074 Würzburg, Germany.

If you are staying at Hotel Melchior, it is less than a 10-minute walk away.

The first session on Wednesday, 1 July, from 08:00 to 14:00, will take place in Room 0.001 on the ground floor. All subsequent sessions will be in Room 1.012 on the first floor of the same building.
